conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 36 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 36 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As Player RED, my goal is to sell my resources at a profit. Since it cost 36 ZUP to produce, I want to start the negotiation with a proposal higher than my cost to allow room for negotiation and hopefully arrive at a price that is profitable for me. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I am offering one unit of resource X, which has cost me 36 ZUP to produce. I believe that 50 ZUP is a fair starting point for negotiations, considering the quality and value of the resource. Let's work together to find a trade that works for both of us. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate the offer and understand the quality of the resource X. However, I would like to propose a trade that reflects the production costs while also providing you with a reasonable profit margin. Let's continue to negotiate and find a middle ground that benefits us both. </other player message>

<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 36 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has made a counter-offer of 40 ZUP. While this offer does provide me with a profit, I believe that the value of the resource justifies a higher price. I will make a counter-proposal that splits the difference between my initial ask and their offer, which should be an attractive middle ground for both parties. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counter-offer. I understand your position and would like to propose a price of 45 ZUP. This price gives me a fair profit for the quality of resource X while also taking into account the costs I've incurred. I hope this adjusted offer aligns with our mutual interests. </message>

<other player message> Thanks for your consideration and the adjusted offer. I believe that a price of 42 ZUP is a fair compromise for both of us. It acknowledges the value of resource X while still being within a reasonable range considering the production costs you've mentioned. I hope you find this offer agreeable. </other player message>

<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42 </other player proposed trade>

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 36 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed a new offer of 42 ZUP. This is a fair compromise that still allows me to make a profit above my production costs. It's close to the middle ground of our previous offers, and it might be a good decision to accept this offer to ensure a sale and avoid the risk of further negotiations that could lead to an unfavorable outcome. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I accept your offer of 42 ZUP for the resource X. This seems like a fair compromise that benefits us both. I'm glad we could reach an agreement. Looking forward to finalizing this deal. </message>
